concept-wr.shortdesc: This component contains documentation for Titanium Server extensions to the open source OpenStack REST APIs.

conbody.p: Together with the standard OpenStack REST APIs, you can use these extensions to manage the Titanium Server cloud.
The following extensions are included in the documentation:

li.p: Allows the user to specify the VIF-Model on a per-NIC basis when they create, launch, or boot a VM server.
Allows the user to scale the resources of a server up and down quickly.
Provides support for various new flavor Extra Specs.
Supports centralized management of provider networks from the controller node.
Supports per-tenant Quality of Service (QoS) policies.
Supports displaying of MTU values for ports, networks, and subnets.
Exports Ceilometer samples to CSV files.
Block Storage API v2 Titanium Extensions
Provides support for backing up volumes and snapshots.
Allows the user to manage physical servers, including inventory collection and configuration of nodes, ports, interfaces, CPUs, disks, and memory.
Allows the user to manage software patches on Titanium Server hosts, including upload, application, installation, removal, deletion and querying of software patches.

conbody.p: Titanium Server Extensions to open-source OpenStack APIs follow the OpenStack 'Extension' Mechanism in order to extend functionality to OpenStack APIs in a manner that ensures compatibility with existing clients.
